quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right Jim. Your quarterlies look very good. How are things at the library?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So you’ve come to the master for guidance? Is this what you’re saying, grasshopper?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. Well, let me show you how it’s done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the phone] Yes, I’d like to speak to your office manager, please. Yes, hello. This is Michael Scott. I am the Regional Manager of Dunder Mifflin Paper Products. Just wanted to talk to you manager-a-manger.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. Done deal. Thank you very much, sir. You’re a gentleman and a scholar. Oh, I’m sorry. OK. I’m sorry. My mistake. [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was a woman I was talking to, so… She had a very low voice. Probably a smoker, so… [Clears throat] So that’s the way it’s done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’ve, uh, I’ve been at Dunder Mifflin for 12 years, the last four as Regional Manager. If you want to come through here… See we have the entire floor. So this is my kingdom, as far as the eye can see. This is our receptionist, Pam. Pam! Pam-Pam! Pam Beesly. Pam has been with us for…  forever. Right, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you think she’s cute now, you should have seen her a couple of years ago. [growls]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Any messages?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! Pam, this is from Corporate. How many times have I told you? There’s a special filing cabinet for things from corporate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s called the wastepaper basket! Look at that! Look at that face.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: People say I am the best boss. They go, “God we’ve never worked in a place like this before. You’re hilarious.” “And you get the best out of us.” [shows the camera his WORLD’S BEST BOSS mug] I think that pretty much sums it up. I found it at Spencer Gifts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whassup!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whassup!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whass…up!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Strains, grunts] What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. All right. See you later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Back to work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Corporate really doesn’t really interfere with me at all. Jan Levinson Gould. [walking out of his office] Jan, hello.  I call her Hillary Rodham Clinton. Right? Not to her face, because… well, not because I’m scared of her. Because I’m not. But, um… Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um… Me no get an agenda.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn’t get any agenda.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? I didn’t… [looks at Pam] Did we get a fax this morning?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why isn’t it in my hand? A company runs on efficiency of communication, right? So what’s the problem, Pam? Why didn’t I get it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, that was a joke. That was a joke that was actually my brother’s, and… It was supposed to be with bills and it doesn’t work great with faxes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah. Lovely. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, this is good. This is good. This is fine. Excellent.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All the alarm bells are kind of going… ringie-dingie-ding!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. No problem.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Me no wanna hear that, Jan. Because downsizing is a bitch. It is a real bitch. And I wouldn’t wish that on Josh’s men. I certainly wouldn’t wish it on my men. Or women, present company excluded. Sorry. Uh, is Josh concerned about downsizing himself? Not downsizing himself but is he concerned about downsizing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Question. How long do we have to… [Telephone rings] Oh uh, Todd Packer, terrific rep. Do you mind if I take it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Packman.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, that’s not appropriate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, I don’t know what you mean.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my God! Oh! That’s… horrifying. Horrible. Horrible person.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, absolutely. Under this regime, it will not leave this office. [zips his lips] Like that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Am I going to tell them? No, I am not going to tell them. I don’t see the point of that. As a doctor, you would not tell a patient if they had cancer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guilty! Guilty as charged!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Howard, like Moe Howard. Three Stooges.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Watch this. This is Moe. Nyuck-nyuck-nyuck-nyuck-nyuck. Mee! [hold hand up for a high five] Ah, right here. Three Stooges. Oh, Pam. It’s a guy thing, Pam. I’m sort of a student of comedy. Watch this. Here we go. [Yelling in cod German] I’m Hitler. Adolf Hitler. [Continues with cod German]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Relax. Everything’s under control. Uh, yeah. Yeah. That’s important. Right. Oh this is so important, I should run to answer it. [Imitating Six-Million Dollar Man sound effect]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on. Six-Million Dollar Man! Steve Austin! Actually, that would be a good salary for me, don’t you think? Six million dollars? Memo to Jan. I deserve a raise.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m sorry?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you’re unhappy with your compensation, maybe you should take it up with HR. OK. Not today, OK? Pam, just be professional. [Sighs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think I’m a role model here. I think I garner people’s respect. [Imitating a PA] Attention all Dunder Mifflin employees, please. We have a meeting in the conference room, ASAP.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: People I respect, heroes of mine, would be Bob Hope… Abraham Lincoln, definitely. Bono. And probably God would be the fourth one. And I just think all those people really helped the world in so many ways that it’s really beyond words. It’s really incalculable.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Now I know there’s some rumors out there and I just kind of want to set the record straight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Assistant to the Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m about to tell everybody. I’m just about to tell everybody.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You don’t know what it is. [Laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t need your permission.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Corporate has deemed it appropriate to enforce an ultimatum upon me. And Jan is thinking about downsizing either the Stamford branch or this branch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not gonna happen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It won’t be out of my hands Stanley, OK. I promise you that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, yeah, it is a promise. And frankly, I’m a little insulted that you have to keep asking about it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know. Hold on a second. I think Pam wanted to say something. Pam, you had a look that you wanted to ask a question just then.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, Pam maybe you should stick to the ongoing confidentiality agreement of meetings.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Stanley. No, you did not see me in there with her. I said if Corporate wants to come in here and interfere, then they’re gonna have to go through me. Right? You can go mess with Josh’s people, but I’m the head of this family, and you ain’t gonna be messing with my chillin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Watch out for this guy. Dwight Schrute in the building. This is Ryan, the new temp.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Introduce yourself. Be polite.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Assistant to the Regional Manager. So, uh, Dwight tell him about the kung fu and the car and everything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s his profit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. Hold on, hold on. The judge is in session. What is the problem here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. Do not take it out. You have to eat it out of there, because there are starving people in the world [turns to camera] which I hate, and it is a waste of that kind of food.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Discipline. Kinky! [Laughs] All right, here’s the deal you guys. The thing about a practical joke is you have to know when to start and as well as when to stop.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And yeah, Jim this is the time to stop putting Dwight’s personal effects into Jell-O.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Laughing] Nice. That’s the way it is around here. It just kind of goes round and round.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! Yes! New guy! He scores.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pudding. Pudding… I’m trying to think of another dessert to do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So have you felt the vibe yet? We work hard, we play hard. Sometimes we play hard when we should be working hard. Right? I guess the atmosphere that I’ve created here is that I’m a friend first, and a boss second… and probably an entertainer third. [Knock at door] Just a second. Right? Oh, hey do you like The Jamie Kennedy Experiment? Punk’d and all that kind of stuff?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are gonna be my accomplice. Just go along with it, OK?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just follow my lead. Don’t pimp me, all right? Come in. So, uh, Corporate just said that I don’t want to…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, thank you. Pam, can you come in here for a sec. Just have a seat. I was gonna call you in anyway. You know Ryan. As you know, there is going to be downsizing. And you have made my life so much easier in that I am going to have to let you go first.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why? Well, theft and stealing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Post-it Notes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: 50 cents, yeah. If you steal a thousand Post-It Notes at 50 cents apiece, and you know,  you’ve made a profit… margin. You’re gonna run us out of business, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. I am.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But the best thing about it is that we’re not going to have to give you any severance pay. Because that is gross misconduct and… Just clean out your desk. I’m sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Pam starts crying] You been X’d punk! [Laughing] Surprise! It’s a joke. We were joking around. See? OK. He was in on it. He was my accomplice. And it was kind of a morale booster thing. And we were showing the new guy around, giving him the feel of the place. So you… God, we totally got you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t know about that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is the most important thing for a company? Is it the cash flow? Is it the inventory? Nuh-uh. It’s the people. The people. My proudest moment here was not when I increased profits by 17% or when I cut expenses without losing a single employee. No, no, no, no, no. It was a young Guatemalan guy. First job in the country, barely spoke English. He came to me, and said, “Mr. Scott, would you be the godfather of my child?” Wow. Wow. Didn’t work out in the end. We had to let him go. He sucked.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [holding up a Dundie and pretending it is talking] Hello. I’m Michael Scott. I’m the best boss in the world.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam! Pam-Pam! Pam has been with us for… forever. Right, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, at one time or another every guy in the office has sprayed on Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Messages?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, right here. Three Stooges. High five. [Michael and Ryan high five] Oh, Pam. It’s a guy thing, Pam. [camera cuts to Pam then back to Michael] Now, who was the one before Curly?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Curly? Very good. Curly Joe DeRita.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, comedy’s kinda my thing. Watch this, here’s Curly Joe. Mmm. Me, me, me, me, me, me. Me, me, me, me, me, me. Oh, I forgot. Here we go. [Yelling in cod German] I’m Hitler. Right. [Continues with cod German] Me, me, me, me, me, me. Curly Joe Hitler. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All these people are walking around and they’re happy and their lives are just going along, ignorance is bliss. But if they knew what was lurking on the other side of that fence that furry monster. [imitating monster] “I’m gonna get you, downsizing.” No. They wouldn’t… They’d freak. And I’m not going to play God. They look to me for support. And they look to me for guidance and leadership. And I think if I could lie to them and it serves them, then that’s what I’m going to do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So this is our sales staff. They are the ones who are making calls and making us lots of money. [comes to a screeching halt and laughs] This is accounting. The numbers dudes. Do not let the job description fool you, they are all completely crazy. Especially that guy, he is a mental patient. [camera zooms in on Kevin] Not literally of course, that wouldn’t work. The last place you’d want somebody like that is accounting. [hides behind office plant] “Very interesting, but stupid.” Artie Johnson. It’s a crazy place.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What you don’t know… Well, it can hurt you, but if you don’t know it won’t hurt you. Then, you can just be happy for a little while at least.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, John Belushi. What a crazy guy. Phew, freaked myself out this morning.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. I thought I found a lump. I checked the, uh… I check the jewels every month. This time… You know, it’s a little different. It was fine. It was fine. But freaky, man, you know. Testicular cancer, God. Cancer, whoa testicles. So… What’s, um… What you eating?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, place around the corner. Nice. All right. See you later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do I need to speak up? [grabs boom microphone] Hello.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think better to be a happy idiot then a, um… Then someone who knows the truth.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, uh, can I help you out in here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gotcha. Good. I’d go with the rows. That’s a good idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today is diversity day and someone’s going to come in and talk to us about diversity. It’s something that I’ve been pushing, that I’ve been wanting to push, for a long time and Corporate mandated it. And I never actually talked to Corporate about it. They kind of beat me to the punch, the bastards. But I was going to. And I think it’s very important that we have this. I’m very, very excited.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Oscar! How are you doing, man?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you have a good weekend going there?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh yeah, I bet it was fun. [to Mr. Brown] Oh, hey! This is Oscar—

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right. See? I don’t even know, first-name basis!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh hey, well, diversity, everybody, let’s do it. Oscar works in… here. Jim, could you wrap it up, please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s diversity day, Jim. I wish every day was diversity day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on people, let’s get ’em in. Get in the cards! Get in the cards!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? This is a color-free-zone here. Stanley, I don’t look at you as another race.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Exactly, were not…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: With tolerance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ignorance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s celebrate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Celebrate good times. Come on! Let’s celebrate diversity. Right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? Here’s what we’re going to do. Why don’t we go around and everybody… everybody say a race that you are attracted to sexually. I will go last. Go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey why don’t you run it by me and I’ll run it by him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. Why don’t we just defer to Mr…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah. Oh, right! OK. First test. I will not call you that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How come Chris Rock can do a routine and everybody finds it hilarious and ground-breaking and then I go and do the exact same routine, same comedic timing, and people file a complaint to Corporate? Is it because I’m white and Chris is black?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will play the Chris Rock guy. I would like to see someone else pull this off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, I will play guy listening.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin is a great guy. He’s a great accountant. He is not much of an entertainer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. I’m sorry. I’m sorry. He’s ruin… He’s butchering it. Could you just let me… [As Chris Rock] Every time… Every time black people want to have a good time, some ignant ass… [Bleep] I take care of my kid!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Bleep] They always want credit for something they supPOSED to do!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [As Chris Rock] What you want a cookie?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Clears throat] I don’t think I can sign this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, OK, it says here that I learned something and I knew all this stuff already, so… I know, I could sign something that says that I taught something, or that I helped you teach something, so… Pam! Where is she? Pam, could we change something on this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here’s the thing. This office, I think this is very advanced in terms of… racial awareness and it’s probably more advanced than you’re used to. That’s probably throwing you off a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, well I know. You told me that several times.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, here I am thinking that you actually cared about diversity training. And you don’t.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I won’t.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “I regret my actions. I regret offending my coworkers. I pledge to bring my best spirit of honesty, empathy, respect and open-mindedness…” Open-mindedness, is that even a word? “…into the workplace. In this way, I can truly be a hero. Signed, Daffy Duck.” [Laughing] He’s going to lose it when he reads that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “I pledge to always keep an open mind and an open heart.” I do believe… in that part of the pledge I that just read. But a pledge? Come on. I mean who are we, the Girl Scouts? No. Look… the guy, “Mr. Brown,” he got us halfway there. He got us talking. Well, no. I got us talking. He got us nothing. He insulted us and he abandoned us. You call that diversity training? I don’t. Were there any connections between any of us? Did anyone look each other in the eye? Was there any emotion going on? No. Where was the heart? I didn’t see any heart. Where was my Oprah moment? OK, get as much done as you can before lunch because, afterward, I’m going to have you all in tears.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right? Everybody pretty? Come on. Here we go. It’s time. Let’s do some good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, this is not a joke. OK? That was offensive and lame. So double offensive. This is an environment of welcoming and you should just get the hell out of here. OK, let’s go. Let’s do it. Come on. Let’s have some fun, everybody. Here we go. Take a seat. Cop a squat. And um… thanks for coming in. Um… Diversity… is the cornerstone of progress as I’ve always said. But don’t take my word for it. Let’s take a look at the tape.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on the tape] Hi. I’m Michael Scott. I’m in charge of Dunder Mifflin Paper Products here in Scranton, Pennsylvania but I’m also the founder of Diversity Tomorrow, because today is almost over. Abraham Lincoln once said that, “If you’re a racist, I will attack you with the North.” And those are the principles that I carry with me in the workplace.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. Questions? Comments? Anybody? Jim?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have something here. I want you to take a card. Put it on your fore… Don’t look at the card. I want you to take the card and put it on your forehead and… Take a card, take a card, any card. Um… And I want you to treat other people like the race that is on their forehead. OK? So everybody has a different race. Nobody knows what their race is, so… I want you to really go for it, cause this is real. You know, this isn’t just an exercise. This is real life. And… I have a dream that you will really let the sparks fly. Get ‘er done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why? Because Martin Luther King is a hero of mine. There’s this great Chris Rock bit about how streets named after Martin Luther King tend to be more violent. I’m not going to do it but it’s…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh this is a good one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Push it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Bom bom bom-bom bom. Come on Olympics of Suffering right here. Slavery versus the Holocaust. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, that was inadvertent. We didn’t actually plan that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, come on. “I like your food.” Come on stir the pot. Stir the melting pot, Pam! Let’s do it. Let’s get ugly. Let’s get real.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’ll notice I didn’t have anybody be an Arab. I thought that would be too explosive. No pun intended. But I just though. “Too soon for Arabs.” Maybe next year. Um… You know, the ball’s in their court.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. All right. No. It’s good. You just need to push it. You need to go a little bit further. All right. OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Voice raised, Indian accent] Kelly, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! Welcome to my convenience store. Would you like some googi googi? I have some very delicious googi, googi, only 99 cents plus tax. Try my googi, googi. [Lowering voice] Try my googi, googi. [High-pitched voice] Try my googi, googi. Try my… [slap!]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [trying not to cry] All right! All right! Yes! That was great, she gets it! Now she knows what it’s like to be a minority.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just hated it when that guy was in here. Mr. Brown, if that was his real name. I mean, he had never met any of us before, and here he was telling us how to do our thing. I just wanted… I just wanted to do it our way. You know? On our own. Man I should have gotten some food.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Kevin. You can take that off that thing, OK? That would really, really have shown him up, wouldn’t it? If I’d brought in some burritos or some colored greens. Or some pad Thai. I love pad Thai.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That doesn’t really make sense. Because you don’t call them collared people, that’s offensive. Hmmm… OK, well, it’s after five. So… Thank you very much. Buena vista Oscar. Thank you. Good job. Oh, my man. Thank you Brazil. Nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. I would like to see us erase 100 years of racism in an hour.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, the country.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, more like a 1,000.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just think that HERO? It’s cute, but it’s… It’s empty, you know? It’s easy. Dwight, you know what, I came up with some terms of my own. Could you put these on the board? The first one is Inclusion, New Attitudes, Color-blind…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Expectations….

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you. Sharing…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And tolerance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it’s not ideal but you have to give me some credit ’cause I made it into a word.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will give you a number of reasons why it is, actually. Okay, first, incest is bad. Racism is bad. No brainer, right? Two, incest. We’re all a family, right? We’re all brothers and sisters. Racial message? Um? Number three, and this is a fact. The states where they have a lot of racism are the states where they have a lot of incest. Okay? And finally…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, wait. Final one, final one this is important. The more we can encourage interracial dating as a society the further away we get from incest, literally.

quotes.speaker: Michael

Um…thanks for listening, those who listened. [clears throat] This last Dundie is for Kevin, this is the “Don’t Go in There After Me” award. It’s for the time that I went into the bathroom after him, and it was really, really smelly. So…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Excellent.

It’s funny how the shelf life of these things, like how long they last, like, “Too much information” probably came on the scene… I mean, I didn’t hear it till, like, this month, so it’s pretty recently. Um, but you know, they’re generally good for, like, no more than five or six years.

quotes.text: Yeah, it was weird. So, she was like ‘I don’t have my ID, please give me one.’ And he was like ‘I can’t do that. I can’t serve you.’

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She might have been. So she says ‘Fine. I will go to my room. I will get my purse. I will come back. I’ll show you my ID.’ She hasn’t come back yet. She’s probably in her room drinking from the mini-bar! Right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight gave a great speech. That’s the word on the street anyway. And I entertained Dwight to no end with my bar stories. So, I captivated the guy who captivated a thousand guys. Can you believe that? A thousand guys?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s it? You’re going to end with “etcetera”? Okay, what’s this big organizational system that…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That would be suicide. Never, never talk specifics. Not in a speech. But the fact that you have no idea what to say is, believe it or not, the least of our worries.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s your delivery…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Our biggest worry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My God, Dwight. The best way to learn is by watching. That’s why porn is a multi-trillion-dollar industry. Listen. Okay. Sit down, let me wow you. [clears throat] [shouting]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: See, I have your attention now, don’t I? You’re scared, but now you’re ready to learn.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it did not. And that is because at no time did you employ the use of humor. We’ll find you a joke that not even you can ruin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, listen up, please. Dwight has a joke.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Iraq is sand. Sailors are on water.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, you know what? We need to… All right, everybody in the conference room now. Let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who’s gonna start. How about Phyllis? You kick us off and then we’ll move around. Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Anything your heart desires.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [shouting] Louder!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Good, good, good. That’s good. Now see, that’s not so hard, right? All right. Who’s next? Who are we going to… Ryan. Ryan’s next.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t be shy, shy boy. Don’t be shy. Get up there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop! Stop! Stop! That’s, you know what? The toast is really not supposed to be about anything. It’s certainly not supposed to be about going anywhere or doing anything else, so…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan is a temp, and that means that he could go at any time. Am I worried about that? Try scared to death.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ghosts. Lots of ghosts in this old Radisson. There it is, Rosebud Room. Memories. Wow, this turnout is pathetic. I packed the house, you know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Numismatic. Numismatic Collectors. Nope, wrong room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. They got sports medicine seminar, nope. Science fiction convention, nope.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re weird.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you a 12-year-old girl? I don’t know. There we go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, look at me. I’m huge in Wilkes-Barre. Performing nightly, Michael Scott. Not comedy fans here, which is fine because not having a sense of humor is just as fine as having one. Questions? Comment? Can’t see you, but I know that you’re not breathing. I know you’re breathing. Is this on? Hello? “Well, isn’t that… Well, isn’t that special?” “Jell-O pudding.” Bill Cosby. I think Bill Cosby said it best when he talked about his brother and all of the fun he… All the great things they did together as kids. And there was the one time when he put the snowball in the freezer, and it… And he waited for five months and then he took the snowball out and he threw it… He would have thrown it at the kid but then his mother had thrown out the snowball so he couldn’t throw it. So… Bill Cosby is smoking! And now some race car. [imitating race car engine] That brings me to my… Brings me to a point that you should always have a list of your clients. It’s important to because a client list is next to godliness… List. [baby crying] Could you shut him up, please? I mean, who brings a baby to a sales conference? Really rude.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam. Ms. Beasley if yer nastay! Janet Jackson. Hey! You having a wardrobe malfunction there? Or w—

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: … Oh, God is that today?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Listen, I like kids. But this is not a kid’s environment. This is like HBO, no limits. Who knows what I’m going to say? Crazy stuff. And it is R rated, it is not rated G. I am like Eddie Murphy in “Raw,” and they are trying to make me into Eddie Murphy in “Daddy Daycare.” both great movies, but, still.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I’ll be in my office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They’re cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fine, fine, fine, fine, fine, fine, fine. Hi, children. I’m Michael Scott, and… I… am in charge of this place… ahh, what’ll make you… understand… I am… like Superman, and the people who work here are like citizens of Gotham City.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, I’m Aquaman. Where does he live, guys?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [under his breath] I work with a bunch of nerds.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yes, hello, how are you? Good to see you. Wow, you’ve really grown up. You know what? Don’t mind me saying so, she is turning into a stone cold fox. Better keep the… frat boys away from her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, middle school’s amazing. It is extraordinary. An extraordinary time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s not that children make me uncomfortable, it’s just that, why be a dad when you can be a fun uncle? I’ve never heard of anyone rebelling against their fun uncle.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [while Jake is throwing things at Michael] They want how many spiral pads?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] Just compare last year’s order to this year’s. Uh-huh. Yeah, I’m looking at it right now. [Sasha walks in the door] … Yes. We–yeah, they’re very–they’re different. [Sasha walks out] Yeah, we can stick with last year’s, you’re just going to have to supplement it, somehow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] Yes. Well… we can… [Sasha walks in, begins playing with Michael’s toy train] uhm… hey, uh, you know what? Can I call you back? I’ll call you right back. Yes, I promise. …Hello, can I help you? … You can pick that up, if you want. That’s— that’s alright. [Sasha moves the train to Michael’s desk] Want to bring it over… here, make some room. My name’s Michael. What’s your name?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, you know what that is! That is a train whistle, like I’m the conductor. [blows into whistle] But I’m sort of the conductor of the office here, right? [blows into whistle] You want to try?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All aboard for sales! Next stop, Cu…camonga! [Sasha and Michael laugh]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight! Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What the hell are you reading to them?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, you know what? No, no no no no. They, no. The kids don’t want to hear some wierdo book that your Nazi war criminal grandmother gave you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s a Nazi?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t! Don’t! Don’t talk about Nazis in front of— you know what? They’re going to have nightmares, so why don’t you just shut it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighing] Why don’t you just leave? Okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright. There goes Mister Poop. Now, who likes Dane Cook?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Children cannot lie. They are innocent, and they speak the truth, and out of the mouths of babes, Michael Scott is freaking cool. [cracks up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is where the magic happens! Right over here, let me show you this. See all these? [pets shelf of paper] You know what that is? That’s paper. This is where paper comes from. Any questions?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, we don’t actually cut the paper. That’s a good question. The paper is sent to us cut, and dyed, from a paper manufacturer, and then we sell it to a business for more than we paid for it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes it is, well, w-w–you need someone in the middle to facilitate…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not just a middle… man…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are describing Office Depot, and they’re kind of running us out of business.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …There’s Creed! Let’s take a look at what he’s doing, everybody! This is Creed, and he is in charge of… something. Right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Say hi to the kids.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yaaaaay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you doing? N–stop it! Stop it! Just–no, no, no, no! No! Would you cut it out?! What is your problem?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No no no, we’re not gonna see— we’re not gonna see the four toed… Creed, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, there’s something interesting about me you might want to know. I … used to be … the star of a kids show.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s true. I did.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am totally serious. There was a show called ‘Fundle Bundle’ and I was the star.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s true! I can prove it! I can prove it, watch this. [gets up and runs out] Ryan, can you come here a second? [clears throat] I would like you to go to my mother’s house in Dickson city, and if she is in the pool, the back kitchen window should be unlocked, I want you to boost yourself up, I want you to go down to the basement. In the basement is a tape labeled ‘Fundle Bundle’. I want you to grab it, I want you to get my guitar.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to get the tambourine. Do you know how to play the tambourine?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oka–

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! Thank you Ryan. Good attitude, hottest in the office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Abby] Alright, nowwww… what kind… of pizza do you like?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t get why parents are always complaining about how tough it is to raise kids. You joke around with them, you give them pizza, you give them candy, you let them live their lives… They’re adults, for God’s sake.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am going to give you a little blast from the past of Michael Gary Scott when he was a child star, and a show that you might remember called ‘Fundle Bundle.’ Okay? Without further ado, Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That… is Miss Trudy. Can’t tell from the costume, but she had an amazing body. Okay, you can… fast forward. And… I want you… to…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop! Stop! Stop! [Ryan resumes the tape] Yes! That is, uh, Edward R. Meow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uhh, I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can everyone please shut up, please! So you don’t miss it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! That’s me. Shh. Shh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Coulda sworn there was…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …uh, no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, just never happened.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, nope.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! Alright, okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …I guess not… you know, I have a load of work to do so I am going to grab a slice of this delish pizza… and I’m going to go do my work. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Toby knocks on door] Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, that’s okay, she can keep those.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You have to ask me that because you work for human resources.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, sure, playing the field is great, don’t get me wrong, but there’s more to life than notches just on my bedpost.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tell me something honestly, do you… think… that it is too late for me to have kids?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What about…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …Jan. Kay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …Or biologically.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks, that’s, no, that… that really means a lot to me. Hey, does Sasha have a godfather, because I…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh… kay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, it is true. I, Michael Scott, am signing up with an online dating service. Thousands of people have done it, and I am going to do it. I need a username. And… I have a great one [types]. Little kid lover. That way, people will know exactly where my priorities are at.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, uh, no, please? You can’t leave yet. There’s still one more thing we need to do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [singing] You… who are on the road… must have a code… that you can live by… [Dwight joins in] and so… become yourself… because the past… is just a goodbye… and teach… your children well…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: One more time. [singing] You…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, don’t touch him, please!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Didn’t do background checks of the warehouse guys. [exclaims] Well, I’m sure it’ll be fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. There you go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, Phil recruited me to sell these cards, and now I am recruiting you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t worry about Phil. He drives a corvette. He is doing just fine. Okay. Calling cards are… the wave of the future. These things sell themselves.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? That’s a nice attitude, Ryan, I’m just helping you invest in your future, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes! Thank you! You will get rich quick. We all will!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, Toby? When the son of the deposed king of Nigeria emails you directly, asking for help, you help! His father ran the freaking country, okay? …Alright, so, raise your hand if you wanna get rich. [Jim and Dwight raise their hands] Alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, let me explain. Again. [draws on board] Phil has recruited me and another guy. Now, we are getting three people each. The more people that get involved, the more who are investing, the more money we’re all going to make. It’s not a pyramid scheme, it is a… it’s not even a scheme per se, it’s… [Jim draws a triangle around Michael’s diagram] … I have to go make a call.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh ho ho! What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you! That’s really nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today is my B-day, and people around here just go crazy for it. I don’t know why. Oh! Fun fact. I share my birthday with Eva Longoria. So, I have a perfect ice-breaker if I ever meet Terry Hatcher.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, thank you sir.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Dwight knocks on door] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh, god.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No no no, no, new suit, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you very much. It is from Italy. [checks jacket] Actually— no, Bulgaria.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good luck. One of a kind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not necessary, the party planning committee is all over it.  They’ve been working twenty-four seven all day yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t! Nope! Please, don’t want to spoil it for anybody. Spoil the surprise.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s get the party started.  Not the way I taught you! [Michael joins in]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [answering phone] Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, great, put her through.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is urgent, I just wanted to call and wish you a happy birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? ‘Cause, I thought we had the same birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks. [grins]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope. Totally private. You can say whatever is in your heart. [Jan hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Ryan, sitting across from Michael] …You can take a five, if you want.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Somebody brought in donuts for my birthday!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Somebody got donuts for my birthday!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You didn’t know it was my birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I guess I forgot to give you a donut [closes box].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go. Ohhhkay, this is great! [giggles] Thank you my friends, she is perfect! Ahhh, Dwight, may I have your chair please? And, um, some singles, if you will! Allllright. Nnnnn-dink! [puts single into delivery woman’s pocket, giggles] Okay, um, alright. This has arms. Is that gonna be a… is that alright?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing] Okay. I’m so nervous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I was seven, my mother hired a pony and a cart to come to my house for all the kids… and… I got a really bad rash from the pony, and all the kids got to ride the pony and I had to go inside, and my mother was rubbing cream on me… for probably three hours, and I never came outside. And by the time I got out the pony was already in the truck. And around the corner. So that was my worst birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [eating donuts while Dwight plays the recorder] Stop it. Stop! What is that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, it’s on the radio. My birthday blows. Nobody even signed my birthday poster. Probably my mother is the only one that cares enough to send me anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re making it worse. I bet Luke Perry’s friends don’t treat him like this [points to James Dean poster].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [grinning] Ohhh, God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohhh, no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh, no, no, no! I can’t… Ryan, come on. Let’s do this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa whoa! Alright. Alright. Watch it… please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get in here… everybody.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Birthday party subs! My gift to you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The best.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, then just have the tomato and ketchup. Still good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just the bread, it’s fresh baked.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-kay. Get whatever you want. [under breath] And choke on it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: When I was sixteen, I was supposed to go out on a date with a girl named Julie. But there was another Michael in the class that she apparently thought the date was with, so she went out with him, on my birthday. And, she got him a cake, at the restaurant. And it wasn’t even his birthday, but I heard about it the next day in school. So… That was the worst birthday I think I ever had.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin? Respect the birthday please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you done? …Good. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uhhh… blow out the candle. Okay. Mmmm… [blows out the candles]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: … I asked for trick candles.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Well, when she comes back we’ll do it again. [notices Meredith hugging Kevin] Hello, what about the birthday boy? Haven’t had a hug all day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: … Aww, that… sucks, great. … Wow, that’s good timing. That’s… that’s, sorry, that’s terrible. Terrible news. That’s terrible… terrible news for both of us [takes cake into office and slams the door].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There you are. Good news. Did some research. It turns out that 98% of people with skin cancer fully recover.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, but it’s not brain cancer. And it shouldn’t stop us from having fun. You know what they say the best medicine is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And laughter… also.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why are you here? I didn’t even invite you to my birthday party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [mocking voice] Nyeh, I work here. [to Kevin] Alright, well, you know what, since Toby doesn’t speak for everybody and I am your boss, I… think you should just go home. Take the rest of the afternoon off. Take a sick day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you’re pretty much driving everyone else here crazy… crazy with worry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Excuse me, everyone. Attention please. Kevin, we’re going to take you to a very special place, a place that will make you happy, and a place that is far, far away from the evil sun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How dare you sir. You are gross.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sees ‘Happy Birthday Michael Scott!’ poster at skating rink] That should not be there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it’s alright. It’s already up. Just leave it. Where’s Kevin? Come on! Let’s get our skate on!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I’ve been pretty much skating my whole life. I thought about playing in the NHL, but, you’re on the road so much. You got no time to spend with your wife and kids. And I really want a wife and kids.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Pam, all this stuff with Kevin… um, it’s pretty scary. And I’m thinking that uh, next time you’re in the shower, you should check yourself out. You know, give yourself an exam. Those things are like ticking time bags. Alright? Think about it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin. You heard anything yet?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Well. Live strong.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Carol? She sold me my condo! Hey! What, is this place on the market? Or…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, these… all your kids?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, hey guys. Whats up? You wanna go for a ride? Is that okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cool. Alright. Grab on. Here we go. Ready? Hang on tight. Alright. We are moving. We are reaaallly mooovin’ now!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Push. Good! That’s great. You got it. [Kevin’s phone rings] Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh… God… [stomps] God! [throws hockey stick and yellow paper bracelet down] We’re gonna beat this, okay? We’re gonna… come here [hugs Kevin].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, apparently in the medicine community, negative means good. Which makes absolutely no sense. In the real world community, that would… be… chaos.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, who’s this from? Wowwwee, look at that! Jersey!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cool. Ohh. Great. From Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you… Dwight. That’s great. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! You didn’t need to do that. …Nightswept. This is… really amazing. Thank you. I love it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s not how I taught you, right? [singing] My hump, my hump, my lovely lady lump Check it out [Dwight imitating drumbeat]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, here’s the thing about bosses and employees. A good boss will say, “Hey, it’s my birthday. Celebrate me.” A great boss will say, “Hey, it’s my birthday. Celebrate yourselves, because you are the ones who made me great, and I will acknowledge your contributions with donuts.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. You know, Ryan, you didn’t have to get me a present.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I think you’re gonna stay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On my 20th birthday, my supposed best friend, Sam Ambrose, ditched me for his twin sister’s Sweet Sixteen party. And that was my worst birthday. Until today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [knock on door] Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, good. Okay. Don’t tell me, tell them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my God. That’s a piece of cake. That’s a piece of cake. Oh, 2%. Jeez, that’s good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Out of, like, 18 billion Americans, so, no worry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Those were probably misdiagnosed. I mean, anybody with a zit goes in and says, “I have cancer.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Untrue. The heart is bigger than the skin. If you stretched the heart out, it would cover more than the entire body.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ry, is he bugging you? Dwight, dude, you gotta take a chill pill, man. It was one joint in the parking lot. You know, you’re totally harshing the office mellow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [fake coughing] Narc!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I wasn’t attempting to compliment you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uuf, well…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [shakes head] Okay…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don’t you just cool it, cool it Dwight, please, God! [to Jim] Dude, where’s my office? [Jim quietly laughs] I totally lost it, ’cause I was half-baked. Smokin’ doobies. Doobie brothers, I was smokin’ doobies with my brothers. Peace out, Seacrest!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks. M-m-munchies. Who wants some munchies?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh-oh. Uh-oh. Who’s he calling?  Ratting somebody out.  Narc!  Narc!  Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Remember the narc bit? [laughs] Uh-oh, who’s in trouble?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Waa… what? What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Two nights ago, I went to an Alicia Keys concert at the Montage Mountain Performing Arts Center. I scored these great aisle seats. Anyway, after the opening act this beautiful girl sits down next to me and I never get to meet girls with lip rings and she had one. I don’t know exactly how this happened but one of her friends started passing around some stuff and they said it was clove cigarettes, and I’m sure that it was clove cigarettes. Everybody in the aisle was doing it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, attention everyone the drug testing has been cancelled.  Instead, I will be going around to each of you and doing a visual inspection.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can do that, it is my office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmmm. Ha. [under his breath] Alright. Great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It has come to my attention that some people here think that the use of drugs is something to laugh about.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, uh, no. That was a test.  I was testing you, and you all failed. Miserably. When I said that Dwight was a narc, how many of you defended him?  How many of you said, “Hey, you know what, he’s right? What he’s doing is protecting this office from the evils of drugs.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am ridiculously anti-drug. So anti-drug that I am above suspicion in any way that involves suspicion, or testing of any kind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Drugs ruin lives people. Drugs destroy careers. Take Cheech and Chong everybody knows that Cheech and Chong are funny, but just imagine how funny they would be if they didn’t smoke pot.  I want everybody to take a look to their left. Now I want everybody to take a look to their right. One of those people will be dead from drug use at some point in their lives. This year more people will use cocaine than will read a book to their children.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are these facts scaring you, or are they not?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you think that smoking drugs is cool? Do you think that doing alcohol is cool?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, enough, enough, enough! I have written down a list of illegal drugs. Take a gander. How many of these are you familiar with?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes it is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, you know what, Toby? Pam, can you take this down? [Pam throws her hands up to indicate she has no notepad] In addition to Toby’s urine being tested, I would like to test his blood and his hair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can test anyone randomly, and I have chosen you randomly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, eeny, meenie, miney, moe, is random.  Okay, you know what? I’m going to need a volunteer to select one of these words and tell us of something tragic that happened in either their lives, or the lives of a loved one.  Yeah, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? [Jim shakes his head no]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim it’s okay. You can t… [Jim looks at Pam and shakes his head, Pam looks at him and gestures for Jim to go up and tell his story] This would be a good place to let it out, Jim. These are people you can trust. These are people who care about you. [Jim shakes his head no] It’s okay, just we will not judge you. We are here to not judge you. [Jim stands up] Oh, he’s doing it, okay. [Jim looks at Pam] It’s okay. [Jim pretends to try, looking teary eyed, shakes his head no, mouths “I can’t” and sits back down. Pam is amazed.] Oh. Okay, are you sure? [Jim shakes his head. Kevin pats his shoulder] That looked like it was going to be good. Alright. [Pam nods in admiration at Jim] Okay, well.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The point I’m trying to make with all of this people is that I hate drugs. I hate them, and based upon what I have seen you all don’t quite hate ’em as much as I do so you are going to have a drug test, and I am not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I will not be.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well Dwight just know that I’ve been very busy today and I got a lot of work to do and I wasn’t planning on going to the bathroom and I don’t even know if anything is going to come out, okay? So good. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So I need you to do some work on the St. Andrews account. I need your urine. I need some filing done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just forget it.  Just the urine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just. I need your urine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes in a cup, we’re not animals, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s none of your business.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Alright. Just, I went to an Alicia Keys concert, over the weekend, and I think I may have gotten high accidentally by a girl with a lip ring.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I need clean urine for the lady.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t think of it that way. It’s like, urine goes all over the place. You know, there’s no controlling it. It just… goes

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A cup could find its way under the urine. It might be an accident. It happens.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, just look. Look. Just… just fill up the cup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight. Well, I passed the test thanks to you and your untainted pee. Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s wrong? Where’s your costume?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why?  Wha…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Since you did such a good job with the investigation, I decided to pull a few strings. Call in a few favors. and I’ve decided to make you official security supervisor of the branch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, sir.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So you wanna? Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Oh. Uh…[awkwardly salutes]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright. [to Hank] Well, Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Drugs are everywhere in our society. They are omniscient. If you look at the amount of pot that was smoked in the United States last year, that would reach the moon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Exactly. I know. It’s amazing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut… Shut it. No. Just… Just focus on the facts. Cocaine. They use cocaine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: One thing that you need to remember is that there’s no way of knowing who’s a user, who’s an abuser, because we don’t know. It could be anybody. Your instinct is to say it’s somebody-like Stanley or Oscar…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no! Your instinct. That… Your gut reaction is to say that, but I don’t! That’s, that’s… Those are instincts that have been created by media and hype. And they are wrong. What I am saying is that you just do not know who drug users are. It may be the person you least suspect. It may be somebody hot, like Pam, or it could be somebody matronly, like Phyllis, but just not me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No? okay, fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well, I really think that… [dial tone beeping]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Sorry you had to hear that. It was a lovers’ quarrel.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, let’s get personal for a second, shall we?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well, I made up some fliers for everybody to take on your way out, in case you’re ever tempted. So there you go. And, Dwight, you know, I’m very busy today. It wasn’t even planning on going to the bathroom, so I don’t even know if anything will come out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t… Let’s just not talk about it, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, thanks, Fantastic Sam’s. Adult Cut Plus. Comes with a shampoo and blow dry. We’re doing I.D. photos today. Gotta represent.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s a nice tie.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is… who makes that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you mind if I wear that for the photo?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walking into the Conference room] What’s the dealio?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s the problem?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So what, you’re having a little spat. I forget, are you guys dating?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you know about conflict resolution? Your answer to everything is to get divorced. So…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay… what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well… that’s not gonna fly here. Because in this office, it is till death do us part… assuming we don’t get downsized. [leans over to Pam] Uh, Pam, will you get Angela and meet us in the conference room please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [holding up a binder] A mediator’s tool chest. Okay, well, before we get started, you should know that are 5 different styles of conflict.[in a comedic voice] My Shaolin temple style defeats your monkey style.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Okay, this is important. The first style is lose/lose.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just hold on, please! Okay, if we do lose/lose, neither of you gets what you want. Do you understand? You… you would both lose. Now I need to ask you, do you want to pursue a lose/lose negotiation?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Win/Win is number four and number five is win/win/win. The important difference here is with win/win/win, we all win. Me too. I win for having successfully mediated a conflict at work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in front of poster] Okay, since this is the disputed poster. Now, one at a time, I want you to express your feelings using “I” emotion language and no judging or “you” statements.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, seriously, that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, okay. Stop, stop, stop! Let’s see if we can just brainstorm and find some creative alternatives that are win/win.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Thank you, Pam. How about Angela makes the poster into a t-shirt, which Oscar wears. That way, he can never see it and whenever she looks at Oscar, she can see it. Win/win/win.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay… well, brainstorm. Own the solution.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, that is called a compromise. And it is style 3. And it is not ideal. To sum up, win/win – make the poster into a t-shirt, win/lose – take the poster down, compromise – Tuesdays and Thursdays. And the answer is… make the poster into a t-shirt! Win/win.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [claps his hands twice] It is done!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are those all the other complains?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would like to see those please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can’t do that, huh? Huh, ok. Now you and I have a conflict. I order you to give me that file.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. [yanks the file away, despite Toby’s resistance] There! No more conflict. [looks at the camera] I had to use win/lose on that. It was not pretty. [looks back at Toby] All right… is that it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh… God. Alright. Why do I have to do everything?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [looking through papers in the complaint box] This is from Kevin. He says Stanley uses his Miracle Whip without asking. Meredith complains that everyone talks too loud in the morning and the lights are too bright. Creed… huh. Duh, duh. Creed is sick of looking at the redhead all day and wants a seat facing the receptionist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You will notice that not one of these complaints is against me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How many of you have at one time gone to Toby to complain about another employee? [looks at all the employees, most of whom raise their hands] And… did you get what you wanted, or were you merely listened to, you forget about your problem, and you move on? [employees mumble “merely listen to and forgotten…” ] That is outrageous! I love this place… and it pains me to see all of the negativity festering… [sighs] Okay, today we are going to get everything out of these files and into the open, where it can be resolved. Alright, how about the Phyllis/Angela dispute?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s what she said. [Jim mouths these words along with Michael] The thing is, Angela… you are in here an awful lot. You have complained about everybody in the office, except Dwight, which is odd because everyone else has had run ins with Dwight. Toby, by the way, what does “redacted” mean? There is a file full of complaints in here marked “redacted”… ?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, ok. There were a bunch of complaints about Dwight that were put in the redacted file about six months ago.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, Pamela. Come on down! Let’s do it! And [looks through the file]… okay. Just one complaint. Actually, it has been withdrawn. So that is no help to us. Next.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh… [reading]”Does she have to plan her wedding on office time? Couldn’t she do that at home?” [Pam looks Angela an angry look] Who else? Why don’t we just warm up first? Warm up emotionally, all right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here is a Kelly complaint: “Ryan never returns my calls.” Ugh, join the club.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [crumbles up the complaint paper] Makin’ progress. [Jim raises his hand] Yes?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stanley. [off camera]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [still of camera] You got a lot of anger under there buddy. Come on start us out. Unleash it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Someone complained that the men’s room is “whites only”. Stanley, you know that’s not true.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Phyllis. You complained that Angela’s giving you dirty looks. And you tried to get off the party planning committee.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And… also, Phyllis, Stanley says that you cry too much, and that bugs him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh… ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well… all settled, then.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, Ryan.  You told Toby that Creed has a distinct old man smell?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, Kevin. You are accused of making sexually suggestive remarks to Angela that made her feel uncomfortable. Solution:  Angela, you are to make sexually suggestive remarks to Kevin that will make him uncomfortable.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh. Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! Calm down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh… kay…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [picks up Dwight’s I.D. and snickers] You know your I.D. says you’re a security threat?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay… you two, in the conference room with me. Nobody leaves until we work this out. Cage match!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cage matches? Yeah, they work. How could they not work? If they didn’t work, everybody would still be in the cage.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, so Dwight, in your own words – [reads from complaint paper] “Someone replaced all my pens and pencils with crayons. I suspect Jim Halpert.” [flips to another paper] “Everyone has called me ‘Dwayne’ all day. I think Jim Halpert paid them to.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [reading] “This morning, I found a bloody glove in my desk drawer and Jim Halpert tried to convince me I committed murder. I think he may be the real murderer.” [flips to another paper] “Jim Halpert said there was an abandoned infant in the woman’s room. When I went to save the child, I saw Meredith on the can.”  Gah. “This morning, I knocked myself in the head with the phone.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [reading] “Every time I typed my name, it said ‘Diapers’.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “By the end of the day, my desk was about two feet closer to the copier.”

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The Japanese have this thing called shiatsu massage, where they dig into your body, very hard. And it is very painful. And apparently, some people throw up. But the next day they feel great. I’ve never had one. They sound awful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, there’s like, 300 more of these. Let’s get to them later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe, I haven’t decided yet. Let’s get to work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Oh… actually, tomorrow’s not good. How about later in the week?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! Wait. How about a group picture while you’re here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well… that’s… what, a computer camera, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’ll take like two seconds.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ugh… All right. Everybody, [looks around at the employees] come on. Group photo for the newsletter.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We resolved a lot today, everybody. Think happy thoughts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good, let’s check that out. [looks at preview screen] Ew, okay, all right. One more. We’ll take one more.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [off camera] You just press the button.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [off camera] Okay, good. Check that out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [off camera] That’s terrible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [off camera] Let’s pay Mr. Price Gouger. [rejoins the group, on camera] Okay… we can do this. Come on, everybody. All right. Here we go. [flash goes off before he sits down]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was really hard getting a good picture of fifteen people. He would not give me a good discount. And eight tries added up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [flashback the photo being taken] One, two..[flash goes off] Didn’t say three, did I?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But, I’m sort of an expert at Photoshop, so it turned out fine in the end. When people work together, there is going to be conflict. You can’t outrun your problems.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And that is why the idea of a cage match is so universally appealing. But here’s the thing about cage matches: sometimes you have to open the cage. And that is something Toby will never understand.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing much is happening today. We are having our photo IDs taken. Whoop-de-doo. Can’t always be like The Apprentice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On Big Brother, something important happens every day. But real life is not like that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I hate it when people don’t tell each other why they’re angry. My dad was like that. I would say, “What’s wrong, Dad? What’s wrong, Dad? What’s wrong, Dad? What’s wrong, Dad? What’s wrong, Dad? What’s wrong, Dad?” Over and over and over. And he would just look at me like I was an idiot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There is this old story about two women who each think they are the mother of this baby. And they can’t decide, so they bring the baby to a wise man. Just like a manager in those days. And the wise man says, “I will adopt this baby and raise it as a Hindu.” See? They didn’t expect that. And that fixed it. Because I think he was the dad anyway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There are dozens of old complaints in here. Cold cases, like the show. [imitating gonging] And Toby is a lazy detective who has decided that these armed robberies and rapes and murder/suicides are not important enough to solve. Well, you know what? I have a problem with that. And I’m going to open up these cases before Toby can kill or rape another person.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow! I never thought Dwight would go postal. It’s always the person you least expect and I always thought Dwight would go postal.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: “Cage Match”? I don’t know if it was in the packet from corporate, because I barely read any of it. So if you’re asking if I stole their idea, the answer is no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tonight the Scranton Business Park is having Casino Night and we are converting our warehouse into a full-blown gambling hall. And I know it’s illegal in Pennsylvania, but it’s for charity. And I consider myself a great philanderer. It’s just… It’s nice to know at the end of the day, I can look in the mirror and say, “Michael, because of you, some little kid in the Congo has a belly full of rice this evening.” Makes you feel good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I try not to think of it as lagging behind. It’s more of a David-and-Goliath thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Top 80 percent!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan, listen, I promise that I will kick it up a notch. Bam!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Emeril. Oh, actually, while I have you, not that I have you or have ever had you, but we’re having our Casino Night tonight and I think everyone would love to see their fearless leader here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am, but you are the Eva Peron to my Cesar Chavez.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, come on. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, it’d be fun. I can hear it in your voice. You need a break.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan and I understand each other. The romance thing is sort of on hold for the time being, but we’ve remained good friends. Good friends with privileges. Not now, some day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, everybody. Tonight’s event is to benefit the Boy Scouts of America.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, they need our money. They don’t have cookies like the Girl Scouts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, Oscar, if you don’t like it, then you should concentrate on winning. Because the person at the end of the evening with the highest chip count will receive $500 to donate to the charity of their choice. And they will get a mini-fridge compliments of Vance Refrigeration.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So get your charities in to Pam. I, for example, am playing for Comic Relief.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Comedy is very much alive, as are homeless people.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, then, they need our money more than ever.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, and another fun thing. We, at the end of the night, are going to give the check to an actual group of Boy Scouts. Right, Toby? We’re gonna…

quotes.speaker: Michael
