quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. That is Josh and Dwight and Jim. [to others] Pam says hi. [into phone] Have fun on your date! Very good, talk to you later. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You first.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not. It hit the rim. Okay, and… okay. Double or nothing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, let’s…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim and I have different definitions of friendship. I think it’s talking and being friends, and Jim thinks it’s moving to Connecticut and being best friends with Josh. Well, phooey on that. I, uh, I’m done. I am not going to be speaking with him anymore. Whatevs. Long-distance relationships never work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, let me tell you what we’re looking for.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sorry, my meeting ran late.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, Jan, really. With a rep from HammerMill.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Used to be. Evan will call you in the morning to work out the details. We can now sell HammerMill products.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well, maybe next time you will estimate me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, first guest! You are going to have some tequila, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is the party.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Party central! So, what can I do you for? [Guy leaves] All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: People have been filtering in and out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure. You like Cosmos?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure, sounds good. So why are you here? Is Josh busy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I get it! No, no, I totally get it. He made a better paper airplane, Stamford is better in sales… I get it. We had some fun. We had some laughs. And that’s just…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not better than Josh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God. You don’t even know. She’s single now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m sorry, man. I’m sorry. Hey, you know what? I will talk to her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will. I’ll talk to her. You should at least talk to Roy. I mean, he knows exactly how you’re feeling.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! No, you know, people have been filtering in and out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Evan, this is Jim.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Ernie, how ya doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Best friends.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Some people need dozens of friends to say, “Hey, look at me, I’m popular.” But not me. I’m very picky. I need three, maybe two. When you meet that someone special, you’ll just know. Because a real relationship, it… it can’t be forced. It should just come about effortlessly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Now, would you do the pleasure of hitting the lights, sir? [lights go out, leaving Michael’s black light on] Ha, ha, ha.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa. What are those stains?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, God, I hope it’s urine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today I’m headed to Philadelphia for the annual Northeastern Office Supply Convention. [makes horns gesture and heavy metal scream] Wooo-yaaaaah! Oh, these things tend to be kind of crazy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Angela enters Michael’s office] Ah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Per-diem. [singing as he signs] Perrrr-diiiiieeeemmmm! [shows off $100 bill to Ryan] You know, Ryan, it’s all about the Benjamins.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [points to door] Right there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. What? Oh, yeah, have Pam give those to me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure you don’t want to come?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gonna be fun! Change your mind we can get you a cot.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A couple of years ago, I went to one in Hartford. “Connecticut.” And Todd Packer and I went to this bar and met a girl. And [laugh] Packer decides to make out with her. Turns out that her boyfriend is the bouncer at the bar. [laugh] I love this. The bouncer chases us out to Packer’s Vette, jump in the Vette, he peels out, and I [laugh] I don’t make it to the car. [turns serious] Um, and the other bouncers caught up with me and really did a number on me… It was in the paper… [brightens] But to answer your question, yeah, I’m really excited about this weekend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: See that factory?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I almost worked there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yup. Yeah, I applied for a job there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was going to be a bottle capper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, I know. Crazy world. Crazy, crazy world.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Josh reminds me of a guy I went to high school with. Big football star, girls loved him. Whatever. Guess what he’s doing now. He’s a TV announcer for the Eagles. Up in the… [laughs] He doesn’t even get to play in the game, I mean.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [waiting on Pam to be done with the microwave] Ahhhhhhhhh. [whispering loudly] I’m hungry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Movie Monday!  The only cure I know for the Monday blues is… Varsity Blues!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s gooooo! Let’s go, let’s go, let’s go!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, everybody here?  Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes pleeeeease!  Thank yooouuu!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Entourage!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin, would you like to do the scenes from last week?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t whine.  Get the window. [Dwight exhales]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Previously on Varsity Blues…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Jan walks in on Movie Monday] Hi Jan! Hope you brought the Milk Duds!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: People work faster after…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No… they have to… to make up for the time they lost watching the movie.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ouchy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Three hours, wow.  Have fun.  [Dwight walks away staring through the blinds at Michael]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.  That’s nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …you were at the dentist?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What was Dwight thinking?  That he could turn Jan against me?  She’s my ex-lover!  …ish.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you want an M&M?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No seriously.  You should have an M&M, they’re really good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They’re good, huh?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.  I thought you weren’t supposed to eat anything for a couple hours after you’ve had a crown put in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sounds like a good dentist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What’s his name?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Your dentist’s name is Crentist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Huh.  Sounds a lot like dentist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let me see your teeth.  Let me see ’em.  Let me see ’em.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You should… floss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [exhales] Well then… I am glad you’re ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Business is like a jungle.  And I… am like a tiger.  And Dwight, is like a monkey, that stabs the tiger in the back with a stick.  Does the tiger fire the monkey?  Does the tiger transfer the monkey to another branch?  [smiling] Pun.  There is no way of knowing what goes on inside the tiger’s head.  We don’t have the technology.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, can I talk to you for a second?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in Michael’s office] Wow, this is tough.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohhhh.  Arrrgggh!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I just got off the phone with Jan.  And um… she demoted me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. You know what the craziest part of this is? She demoted me to your job!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And she said that you should be expecting a call later from corporate, and that um, I guess that means that you are going to be acting manager of Dunder Mifflin, Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know.  I told her I didn’t know whether you’d wanna do it… because you’ve always been so loyal to me.  You’ve been my most trusted ally.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep, I did.  I did.  But I think… you should do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [exhales] Perfect, well, we’re settled.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.  Well then, you are now acting manager of Dunder Mifflin Scranton Branch, and I… am assistant regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh..

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [muttering] Can’t you?  That’s so nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well… I guess we should go tell the troops.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hi, hello.  Everybody, I have some good news, and I have some bad news.  I… am being replaced, as your leader, by Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You might think that I am kidding, and I understand that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because, Dwight… never lies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because that’s all it takes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, Dwight, would you like to say a few words to everybody… about loyalty?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I’ll be fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, I don’t, but—

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I… won’t.   I won’t.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I guess it’s time, that I turn over the keys, to the famous Sebring.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s a corporate lease Dwight, you’ve earned it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But you said you liked it.  You’ve always admired it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Michael finally breaks] Take it back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s my car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: THAT’S MY CAR.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, Dwight.  I know.  I know.  I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan called me about your little meeting!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, what you did.  I made the whole thing up, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh do you?  Do you like the Sebring— HOW DARE YOU?!  How dare you, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Give me one good reason why I should fire you RIGHT HERE ON THE SPOT?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not.  Good.  Enough!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have a laundry machine!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t know if I can trust you anymore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can get up.  Get up. [Dwight gets up with spit hanging from his lips] And you can hug it out, bitch.  [Dwight and Michael have a firm embrace]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hug it out, bitch.  That is what men say to each other, after a fight.  They hug it out, and doing so, the just… let it go.  And walk away.  And they’re done.  Not a good idea to say that to a woman however.  I have found.  It doesn’t translate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep.  Yeah, we hugged it out.  But, it turns out, I was still a little angry.  So, I felt I needed to punish him, just a little bit more, [cut to Dwight standing on a box with “LIAR” written on a piece of paper hung around his neck, Dwight’s head hung in shame] and I’m making him do my laundry for a year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. [Jan leaves Michael’s office; Dwight enters]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is not your business, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you know about management, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I’m not firing anyone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: … What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Here we go. Everybody, you know what? It dawned on me we were all in there watching a movie together before we were so rudely interrupted, Let’s get back in there. [no takers] Come on. Movie Monday! Come on, Stanley let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well, we had scheduled this time to watch a movie together, so I guess I will just go play some online Scrabble.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, she sleeps with him, but she is still in love with the head surgeon, um, the McDreamy guy, and she starts crying, but the dorky doctor, he’s in love with her… [phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Ryan, can I get you a pencil from the warehouse?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, it’s okay, I’m going down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, I’ll be right back. [goes down pretend stairs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [hands Ryan pencil]  There you go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You’re welcome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don’t mind if I do.  See you in a minute.  [goes back down pretend stairs and grabs pen from Stanley’s desk]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There you go, fresh from the warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There’s coffee in the kitchen, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [breathless] All right.  Okay. [goes back down pretend stairs, crawls on belly to the kitchen for the coffee]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am like Bette Midler in For the Boys.  Gotta keep the troops entertained.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oookay.  Let me see if I have his cell.  Is this the only reason you are calling, Jan?  Or does somebody miss me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Attention, everybody.  I just received a call from corporate with some news they felt that I should know first.  My old boss Ed Truck has died.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I am.  It’s very sad.  Because he was my boss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s right, you worked with him.  So did Creed.  Well, I’ll be in my office in case anybody wants to drop by.  Cheer me up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So did you hear the news?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, gosh, what can anybody do, really?  It’s… pssssh… .  He was almost 70.  Circle of life.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [holds out arms to Pam]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.  Mmmmmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.  Must really have you thinkin’.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The older you get, the bigger the chance is you’re gonna die.  You knew that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is just not the way a Dunder Mifflin manager should go, I’m sorry.  Alone, out of the blue, and not even have his own head to comfort him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clears throat] So, I’m not exactly sure how to say this…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn’t… he was driving on the road and he went under a truck.  And that’s when his head was separated from the rest of him.  And I will let you know more as soon as I find out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don’t understand. We have a day honoring Martin Luther King, but he didn’t even work here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You really don’t get it, do you?  You don’t understand these people.  That is the last thing that they would want is a day off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [thoughtfully] A statue.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I think it would be very realistic, it would look just like him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We could have his eyes light up, we could have his arms move…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think that is a great way to honor Ed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Life-size.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, we are talking about how to properly honor a man who gave his life as regional manager of this company, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm hm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh do you?  You know who wished they could get back to work is Ed Truck.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But Ed truck can’t because he is—

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: DEAD.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That’s perfect.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oohh… can you imagine how much blood there was?  If it happened right here, it would reach all the way to reception.  Probably get on Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you know what?  I didn’t wanna hear about it either, Stanley, but I did and now I can’t stop picturing it.  He leaves work, he’s on his way home… wham!  His cappa is detated from his head!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you know what?  There’s something wrong with you.  There is something wrong with everybody in here.  Because we have lost a member of our family and you don’t wanna talk about it, you don’t wanna think about it, you just wanna get back to work!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There are five stages to grief, which are [glancing at computer screen] denial, anger, bargaining, depression, and acceptance.  And right now, out there, they’re all denying the fact that they’re sad.  And that’s   hard.  And it’s making them all angry.  And it is my job to try to get them all the way through to acceptance.  And if not acceptance, then just depression.  If I can get them depressed, then I’ll have done my job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am going to throw you this ball.  When you catch the ball, I want you to say the name of a person very important to you, somebody really special who died, and then I want you to say how they died, and you may cry if you like, that is encouraged.  Let me just start.  Let me show you how this works.   I catch the ball.  I lost Ed Truck.  And… it feels like somebody took my heart and dropped it into a bucket of boiling tears… and at the same time, somebody else is hitting my soul in the crotch with a frozen sledgehammer… and then a third guy walks in and starts punching me in the grief bone… and I’m crying, and nobody can hear me, because I am terribly, terribly… terribly alone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, fine.  Hurry back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as Pam returns to conference room] Okay, we can start.  Um…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.  Pam, you’re a member of this family.  So we will wait for our family members. Phyllis, you wanna give it a shot?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, why don’t you throw the ball to somebody else.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [returning ball to Stanley] Oh, yes Stanley.  Come on.  Your turn, you have to go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay… I’m going to toss the ball to Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow.  If you wanna cry, that’s okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you want to talk about it anymore?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait a second.  That’s Weekend at Bernie’s. [upset] Do you think that this is a game?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, we’re starting over.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are not leaving.  No!  We are not done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.  Well, you know what?  The guy who had my job has died.  And nobody cares!  And he sat at my desk. [breaking down]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How do you know?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That that bird was dead?  Did you check its breathing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Was its heart beating, Toby?  Did you check it?  No, of course you didn’t.  You’re not a veterinarian.  You don’t know ANYTHING! [runs out of conference room crying]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [seeing bird] Oh, God!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God!  Oh my God, come on …

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh shhhh–oot!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, he’s not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, he’s not. [cradling bird next to face]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you can’t get diseases from a bird!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We don’t know if it’s dead.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Attention everybody.  This will only take a second of your time.  Today at 4 p.m. we will be meeting in the parking lot to have a funeral service for this bird.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I’m sorry to inconvenience you, Meredith.  But that is what you do when things die.  You honor them.  Toby killed this bird.  And now we are going to honor it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no!  That’s enough!  You know what?  This bird is dead.  He died alone.  The least you can do is be there for him now. [to Dwight] Find a box for him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s okay.  It’s okay. [pats Kelly on shoulder] Shh… yes, I know, I know. It’s been a tough day, but it’s good to let it show.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are… What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, God, no it’s not!  What is the matter with you?  Is that the beak!?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Glad you could all make it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, do you have the box?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You made this?  Wow. [impressed] That’s… that’s very nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shhh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Society teaches us that  having feelings and crying is bad and wrong. Well, that’s baloney, because grief isn’t wrong. There is such a thing as good grief. Just ask Charlie Brown.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, wow. He…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Does his family know?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But I’m the first in the office?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, yes, sure, I will do that…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: …’Cause I’m the first to to find out. Nobody else knows and it is my responsibility to tell them. Well, good. How are you holding up? Want me to come over? [Jan hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ed Truck died. And it blows. They say that with grief, time makes it worse, which is bad for me because I found out before anybody so I’ve had more time to be sad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would like you all to clear your schedules this afternoon, because I am telling corporate to send in a grief counselor. We need to find out what is blocking you. And that way, we’ll be able to honor Ed the way he deserves to be honored. May he rest in peace.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What was that, Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you said something, didn’t you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You think that’s funny.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, that can’t be right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, then I guess that makes you about the worst grief counselor in the world, doesn’t it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let’s face it. Moving to a new job can be very stressful. So I have made an orientation video especially for you newcomers. But it’s not like any orientation video that any of you have ever seen. It’s funny. It’s got a little bit of a zing to it and I hope that it gives you a flavor of what we’re all about here at Dunder Mifflin. And what we’re all about here in Scranton. So let’s just all laugh together and watch “Lazy Scranton”.

quotes.speaker: Michael

quotes.text: Whoa, Angela! Hold on. Hooters is a restaurant. With over 400 locations worldwide.

quotes.text: The word merger comes from the word marriage. And that was what today was supposed to be. The loving union between people. Instead, it has become like when my Mom moved in with Jeff. And once again, it becomes my job to fix it.

quotes.text: Hey! Hey, everybody! Something happened! Those guys from Vance Refrigeration, they let the air out of our tires.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah! They punk’d us! They punk’d us good! Come on. Come on!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Man, they got us so bad. We cannot let them get away with this. We have got to pull together as one and steal their refrigerators.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Go home, Toby. Just…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No, no, no. No.  You are falling for it. You’re playing right into their hands. This is just what they want you to do. Don’t, oh…

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So I think in order for us all to work together well we must come together as a family and then we can all be [starts to fan out the rest of his cards facing the group showing kings of hearts] a king of hearts.

Okay? As a matter of fact, you show me a white man you trust and I will show you a black man that I trust even more. Pam. Tell me a white person you trust.

Now slowly open your eyes again. Who are you picturing? A black man? Wrong. That was a white woman. Surprised? Well, shame on you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. That’s not cool. You don’t have to tell them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, we are running a business, so.

quotes.speaker: Michael

quotes.speaker: Michael

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! Listen up everybody! Um, you guys said that prison was better than this place, and I heard ya, loud and clear, so, I am instituting some changes to make this more like prison. We are going to start with an hour of outdoor time. So let’s go!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don’t we… pump some iron? Anyone wanna… pump up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It’s uh… two and a half. I’m not going for bulk, I’m going for tone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, it’s… freaking cold out here. Anybody wants to stay out, you’ve got about… twenty-seven minutes of rec time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh heyyy. Martiiin. You have TV in the joint?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah. A ten inch black and white?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: These people don’t realize how lucky they are. This office is the American Dream. And they would rather be in the hole.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right everybody, there has been a lot of name calling against our office today. Corporate maligning, slurring, much of it coming from one of you, who claims that prison is better… than… here. And none of can say “Boo” because none of us have ever been to prison. Well, there’s somebody I’d like you to meet. Somebody else who has been to prison, who can tell you what it is really like [puts on bandanna]. I’m prison Mike! You know why they call me prison Mike?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you really expect me to not push you up against the wall, beeyotch?! [employees protest] All right, hey, hey, hey, hey, that’s just the way we talk in the clink. Been a lot of fun talk about prison today, but I am here to scare you straight. I AM HERE TO SCARE YOU STRAIIIGHT!! In prison you are somebody’s bitch. Oh, and you. [points to Ryan] You, my friend, would be da belle of da ball. Don’t drop the soap! Don’t drop the soap!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Internet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And prison. Eh, fifty-fifty, both. Look, prison stinks, is what I’m saying. It’s not like you can go home, and, recharge your batteries, and come back in the morning and, be with your friends, having fun in the office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I stole. … And I robbed. And I kidnapped… the… president’s son. And held him for ransom.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I nevah got caught, neither.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gruel. Sandwiches. Gruel omelettes. Nothing but gruel. Plus, you can eat your own hair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Yeah. Well, thank you, Andy. Tanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The worst thing about prison was the… was the Dementors. They… were flying all over the place, and they were scary. And they’d come down, and they’d suck the soul out of your body, and it hurt!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, not Harry Potter. … There are no movies in prison. This is my point! You guys got it soft, and cushy! This place is freaking awesome! The people are awesome! Your boss is nice! Everyone seems to get along! People are tolerant! People who… have jumped to conclusions can redeem themselves! Nobody is nobody’s bitch. I hope that this scared you. And from me, Prison Mike, to you, I just wanna thank you for listening to me. Letting me be a part of your life today. ‘Cause you got a good life! YOu got a good life. A good life. [turns around, takes bandanna off] So. What do you think? It doesn’t sound so great, does it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Okay, fine. You guys think prison is so great? All right. Well, here you go. [locks employees in conference room]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! If you think is prison is so wonderful, then, enjoy prison! They are such babies. I am going to leave them in there until they can appreciate what it’s like to have freedom. And if this doesn’t bother them, then I am out of ideas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They were very disrespectful to me, and to the office. And Martin has had a bad influence, to think that I gave him the benefit of the doubt.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. You know what Toby? I am teaching them a lesson, so.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [unlocks door] Okay nutcases, get out of there! Good work. Long day. Really long. Why don’t you guys head home. Early. Time off for good behavior! Heh. Good job. Enjoy your freedoms!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Martin went from being a new guy from Stamford… to a convict, to… my friend. Back to a convict. Then to… a kind of a nuisance, actually, to be completely honest. And finally, to… a quitter. And I will not miss him. And that is not because he is black.

quotes.text: [Riding a bicycle down the hallway and singing] Deck the halls with boughs of holly. Fa la la la la la la la la. [Struggling to stay on] ‘Tis the … ack. [expletive] Hey! [to Pam] I would like a nice slice of Christmas Pam. Side of candied Pams. And perhaps, some Pam-chops, with mint…

quotes.text: Well, that is probably from the test drive.

Pack your bags, we’re leaving the day-after-tomorrow! Um,  taking her to Sandals, Jamaica, all-inclusive. All-inclusive. You know what that means? Right? Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not as much as I need a moment alone with you. [puts finger on her back and reaches for her butt] Berp.

quotes.text: That is my Christmas card. It’s a picture of you and me and your kids on a ski trip, having a blast. Ski-sons Greetings.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sounds good. Okay, let’s go.

michael.summary: Michael is the regional manager of Dunder Mifflin Paper Company in Scranton, Pennsylvania. Michael thinks of himself as an extremely capable boss who can handle any problem efficiently. In reality, Scott is ill-equipped to handle most of the problems that arise at Dunder Mifflin. Michael loves to host conference room meetings where typically very little is accomplished but he gets to be the center of attention.
michael.name: Michael Scott

jim.summary: Jim is also in sales and is considered to be one of the "heroes" of the show because of his laid back attitude and ability to get along with people. During the course of the series, Jim marries Pam Beasley and subsequently becomes quite motivated to succeed as a paper salesman. There are many instances in The Office where Jim spends very little time attempting to increase his paper sales instead spending considerable time trying to win the affections of Pam. Jim also spends an inordinate amount of time playing tricks on Dwight or entertaining his co-workers which he primarily does to entertain Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I mean, it’s an iPod. But ..

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry, I ..

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe because you hated her present so much.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How much?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know. It’s totally going to change the way I work out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So what are you going to get me instead?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs] No, I was just checking out my present. [holds up teapot]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I traded with Dwight. Just, I figured, you know, you went to a lot of trouble and it means a lot. And also, Roy got me an iPod or was going to get me an iPod, so ..

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [opens teapot] Oh my god! The yearbook picture!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I think I made the right choice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, my God! It’s incredible. [Jim reaches and steals his card back before she can notice it] Is this the Boggle timer?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you want me to help you with that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you kidding?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just let us open up the presents, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It was supposed to be for Meredith, ’cause she said she likes my drawings.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry. What do I want? What do I want… Oh, it’s a pencil cup.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, I don’t think so, I just bought it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I love these.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Last week, Michael sent out this mysterious memo.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A ski mask and a swimsuit.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And brush our teeth.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How about the anchor?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think you’re thinking of The Hunt for Red October.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I’m not going to do that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, why don’t we find like a quieter place to hang out?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s getting kind of rowdy down there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sometimes I just don’t get Roy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I mean, I don’t know. So… what’s it like dating a cheerleader?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m cold.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, I’ve been engaged for three years, and there’s no end in sight. So… you don’t wanna ask my advice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no, I want my mom and dad to be there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How about the anchor?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You’ve been to the lake before?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, you should have.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Love you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, what’s wrong?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, wait wait wait wait…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, do you need me to call an ambulance?!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wait a second, I thought you said that you were hurt.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [exasperated]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, I have to stay here and answer the phone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, is, um, sick and he wants one of us to rescue him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, why don’t you call your girlfriend?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What was that?! [everyone runs to Michael’s office window]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ohhhhhh!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my gosh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is he ok?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You missed two big conference calls today, one with corporate.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I didn’t mention that you cooked your foot.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You didn’t have any.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And do my job?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s just that before, you said that you didn’t want any special treatment.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you want some aspirin, because you seem a little fussy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You’ve seen one of these?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy gave it to me for Christmas.  I’m trying to figure out how to put songs on it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh! Ha, haha.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Pan?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, God.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [phone rings] What.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Tell me before I come there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That is so cool.  Thanks Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh God no, Dwight isn’t my friend… Oh my God!  Dwight’s kind of my friend!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, he’s actually been really nice and helpful.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, you have your hand up.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, here, let me help you Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Get up, get up.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just want to say goodbye ok?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, I know, but it’s gonna be different.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s just hard to explain.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my goodness!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Come here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God, what is going on, is Dwight ok?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can’t believe he’s getting a CAT scan.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really? Michael went in with him?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, that’s uh, good news [Pam sees Angela eavesdropping] Uh, yeah, no I’ll let you go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just wanted to let you that Dwight’s gonna be ok.  The doctor said there’s a really simple treatment for a concussion, so he’ll probably even be back at work tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just, uh, thought you’d want to know that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I can not believe I fell for that. [laughing] Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I bought my veil.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ummm…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok. I was thinking about wearing it down. Kind of like, I don’t know, like loose with big curls and…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s a communal bowl.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sick, like lots of sniffling. I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Umm. How many different ways are there to sniffle?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, it was the second one.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nuh-uh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What did you guys talk about?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I hate you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did you find anything good in your desk?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Score.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Big day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I know, like, I kind of like, I thought that maybe you did when I first started.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I mean, just ’cause we like got along so well.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So are you going to be like totally awkward around me now?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm, hmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, here’s your schedule for next week. Are you okay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no, that’s, you don’t have to.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, really, it’s okay. I know that Jim had, like a crush on me when he first started. But that was a long time ago, so.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim had a crush on me on the booze cruise or he told you about it on the booze cruise?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No thanks. You got a package.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, Pam plus Spam plus…?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It was great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy and I just got back from the Poconos.  I get ten vacation days a year, and I try to hold off taking them for as long as possible, and this year I got to the third week in January.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [looking at pile on Michel’s carpet] Oh… I don’t know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I don’t think it’s a bird.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Open the door up!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A little.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [giggles at Roy]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You’re gonna throw my things on the ground?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Roy in Jim’s earshot] …back so soon.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, that’s right.  We could do a three-day weekend.  I wonder if I could, like, call in sick on the Friday.  Then I get a four-day weekend.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Roy as Jim escapes into bathroom] Are you kidding?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Somebody did something bad to Michael’s carpet. Maybe that’s all we need to know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That doesn’t seem fair.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What’s our punishment?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, Jim.  It’s Pam.  I keep looking up to say something to you and then Michael’s there and it’s horrible.  Anyway, I’m bored.  Come back!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, guess what?  I moved my computer so I can’t see Michael’s head.  It’s working.  I think I can have a career as a very specific type of decorator.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim]  Sudoku. Level moderate. 18 minutes. Suck on that, Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] I’ll transfer you.  Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam.  Hold, please.  Dunder Mifflin, this is … okay, sorry.  Michael was standing at my desk, and I needed to be busy or who knows what would’ve happened, so thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, what’s that word we made up when you have a thing stuck in your shoe?  Anyway, I have a thing stuck in my shoe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] Hey, I have a chance to sneak out of here early, and I’m not messing this up, so I’ll see you tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [voicemail message for Jim] Calling from my cell phone.  I don’t know if you guys figured out who did that to Michael’s carpet yet, but I have a theory that involves an inter-departmental conspiracy.  Everybody in the office.  We need to talk.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Today’s a ‘women in the workplace’ thing. Jan’s coming in from Corporate to talk to all the women about… um… I don’t really know what. But Michael’s not allowed in. She said that about five times.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jan.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael’s still at the door.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don’t know how I fit in with these women. Here. Or with Jan. Um… I mean we get along great. Fine. Um… I guess the person I have the most in common with is…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well… I always dreamed of a house with a terrace upstairs. Plant flowers on it… stuff like that. Since I was a girl. Um… More seriously though, a husband that I love… Roy. And I love to draw. And I… I did a little in college and I’d still love to do something where I could work with art or graphic design in some way.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well… I have a job right now, so I can’t really take time off…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well… it’s just that the weekends aren’t good because, um…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How’s it going down there?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good. We watched a video about our changing bodies.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Almost.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um… but hey? Something kind of cool. There’s this internship in graphic design that Jan was telling us about. She made it sound, like, really great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s really cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dreams are just that. They’re dreams. They help get you through the day. Like the thing about the terrace. It’s nice but… um… I don’t know. It was just something I read in this book when I was twelve. The girl in the book has a terrace outside of her bedroom and she planted flowers on it and I just loved that. Just always kind of stuck with me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How did you know?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just like no big reason. Just a bunch of little reasons.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy’s right. There’s no guarantee it’s going to lead to anything anyway.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What? You have something you want to say?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, excuse me! I’m fine with my choices!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s impractical. I’m not going to try to get a house like that. Um… they don’t even make houses like that in Scranton. So, I’m never going to… .

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin. This is Pam. Uh… hold, please.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You did?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How about that one?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I really like Valentine’s Day in this office. It’s kinda like grade school. Everybody gives out little presents and stuff. Like last year, Jim gave me this card, with Dwight’s head on it, it was horrifying and funny and…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Delivery man enters with a bouquet of red roses. Pam stands up to look at card.] Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy and I are saving for the wedding, so I made him promise not to get me anything too big.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s OK.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Guess what?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s great. [Meredith scowls]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OH, Holy God!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You can’t fire me, Dwight, just ’cause Michael’s not here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You need to get something for your girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Tightly wound?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, well, sometimes the gift is really about the gesture, you know, like what it means, instead of what it is.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, not like a ham. It’s about doing something, so that the person knows that you really care about her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That you remember her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [delivering plant to Oscar’s desk] Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [walks away] Join the club.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I guess, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nothing, it’s just I had to sit here all day, while Phyllis got like an entire garden delivered to her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I mean, I know that we said no big gifts, but I was kind of hoping you’d get me something for Valentine’s Day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Heading out?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Bye. [Jim leaves]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Night Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael’s got a few tricks for Valentine’s Day. He found a place where you can get 12 plastic roses for $10 and he’s got a great line. “Me so thorny.”

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You have any big Valentine’s Day plans, Kev?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Where is she?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m gonna spend it with my fiance.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you guys doing?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you sad that Dwight beat you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you going to cry, Jim? Do you need a tissue?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh! I… uh… yeah. Um… I’ll uh show them to you later.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have a ton of stuff to do for the wedding. And I have to do it in the office. And that can be kind of awkward. Um… just because people can get all weird about wedding stuff. Then… I just… I don’t want to offend… Angela… or someone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mom, I’m sorry. I know you and Dad are chipping in for the wedding but I do not want orange invitations. Yes! Well, if you really want my…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do we know anyone who was in the accident?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You mean Toastmasters?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, the bride doesn’t really do… Have you ever been to a wedding?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy has a connection. It’s nicer than you think.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Of course. He’s one of my closest friends.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe we’ll use a DJ. That’s the one thing Roy’s in charge of for this wedding but all he’s managed to do is set a date.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ryan, you should be more sensitive. It’s obvious she likes you and comments like that, they just…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Australia? I have always wanted to go there?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s awesome. Where are you staying?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: When are you leaving?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh yeah. That’s too bad.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s ok. I got it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, but they are both in danger.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The ones that say “love” on them?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. Doesn’t matter.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: As soon as they leave, well get Kelly and start.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is that okay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m looking forward to ‘Take Your Daughter to Work’ day. I am not great with kids, but I wanna get better. Because I’m getting married. So, I put out a bunch of extra candy out on my desk so the kids will come talk to me. …Like the witch in Hanzel and Gretel.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I have more. [Holds up bags of candy]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, Michael. You can’t be nasty today. [whispering] ‘Cause of the… [points to ‘Welcome Daughters!’ sign]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I reminded you last night.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Don’t you think you should say something?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, I think that as the boss you should really—

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Abby! Do you want to help me shred some old documents? It’s actually pretty cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I only have one goal today. To make one kid like me. Just one.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That is!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He’s not coming out. He won’t pick up the phone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, Melissa… I met your mom a couple times. She’s so nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You’re welcome.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s not too bad. I get to shred things sometimes, do you want to see?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. Um… here it is. Don’t put your fingers in there. [shreds paper] Cool huh?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I get to do this like, every week.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think he thought his ukulele skills would transfer. [Jim leaves]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: My theory is that… [Jim signals he’s leaving, waves bye to Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I like extra cheese, too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. Do you like to draw, Abby?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Me, too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. It’s been a little more tiring than I thought.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Happy birthday Michael.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I said happy birthday.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: One’s good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael wants a strippergram?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, I have Jan on the line.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can sign for it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: When does he hear?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ohh… poor Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: If I knew I had a week to live, I would… probably go to Europe. And South America. And the Grand Canyon. And… I would want to see the Pacific Ocean. …It would be a pretty busy week.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: …I feel like we should go get Kevin something. Do you think we can sneak out of here?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sixty-nine cup of noodles.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And his favorite lunch.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You use fabric softener?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [checking watch] We should probably head back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You dare me? How old are you?

quotes.speaker: Pam

quotes.text: I decided to come. Uh… I feel a little under-dressed… but at least I’m not dressed like a slutty cheerleader, right? Is that mean?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can you believe my boss proposed to his girlfriend in public? That is so Michael.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. Hey, would you excuse me for a second?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s hot in there. How’s the naan?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I am. You should come dance with us.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No one.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Here. [hands drink]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh… no.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, you were never really engaged.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I kind of thought something would happen tonight too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m rejecting your…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: …kiss.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: If you sit in the back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You say one more word; I’m stopping the car.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] Michael, you’re on with Jan.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Your shirt is buttoned wrong.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you okay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What did Jan want?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What can’t you tell me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You just said that we’re gonna be gone…?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, what’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s a blessing in disguise. Actually, not even in disguise. Sometimes at home, I answer the phone, “Dunder-Mifflin, this is Pam.” So, maybe that’ll stop now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, good… you’re bringing Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He’s not here. I don’t know where he is.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is it because of Michael? Did he actually do something?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure, uh, Jan… um, do you know, is anyone coming back to Scranton?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Coming to Scranton. Is anyone coming to Scranton?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I guess some new people might be coming from Stamford. Should be fun. New blood.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s, um… I hadn’t thought about it, huh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, that might be weird. Overall though, we still all have our jobs… so, good news, right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No thanks, guys.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Have fun though.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really? Where did you hear that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, me too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe this is good. Finding another job is a pain. There’s another annoying boss, another desk, I’d have to learn everything all over again. So, there are reasons to stay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How’d the run go?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s great!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because he accomplished something.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really, Dwight? How fast are you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I’ll just time him later.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. Are you ready?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Set

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Go!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Am I being mean to Dwight? I don’t know. I did just make him run around the building and I have no intention of timing him. This isn’t even a stopwatch. It’s a digital thermometer. He does make my life harder, sometimes. And on purpose. Like he tried to put meters on the bathroom stalls as a way of bringing in more money for the company. [yells to Dwight] Hey, three more laps to go. Gotta pick it up if you’re going to beat Toby.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I should probably get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good morning!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes! I’m in a good mood today! I’m excited to meet all the new people and to see my old friend again, definitely. That’s always a thing that makes people happy… to have an old friend back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I’m Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, thanks. My Mom made it for me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my god! It’s really you!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know. I don’t care.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s really good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You won’t be disappointed.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What happened to grape soda?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. You’ve changed so much.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So when do I get to hear everything? Are you still getting unpacked or… you want to grab a coffee or something after work?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, no! You know. Whenever.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. I know, me too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The day’s going fine. It’s been a little chaotic but it’s fine. It’s great! A lot of distractions. But, it’s good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh… no. I just uh had some other stuff I had to do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What’s up?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. That’s totally cool. You can do whatever you want.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We’re friends. We’ll always be friends.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s good to have you back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is weird with you facing the other way.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s Stanley Hudson.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He’s one of our salesmen.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh very.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hmm, that is… Janet Fenstermaker.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Pam nods head] You should say hi. Use her full name.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, that is Creed Bratton. He has four toes and he fought in the Civil war.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: For both sides. Whoever paid more.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ohhhh! She’s absolutely adorable!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: …Oh, sorry. He’s–he’s dressed all in pink.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: …Oh. That’s… fun for him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [whispering] Who is it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why would anyone go to jail for that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. Angela?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: My dad.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What was prison like?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, some days I never go outside.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: They have art classes?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Kinda sounds like… prison’s… better than Dunder-Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow… I–

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow. That was… wow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, it’s freezing out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Prison Mike? What was the food like in prison?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow. Thank you. Um, that must have been hard for you to relive that. Both of you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Merry Christ–[looks up] NO! Why… why did you bring that here?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, what uh…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, get it out of here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I would like it off my desk.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can I help you, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It’s behind you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [hands over bag] I didn’t, it’s from corporate.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Psst. Jim. [Jim turns around. Pam nods head towards her for him to come over] Um, hey. I need to give you your Christmas gift now because, well, I’ll just tell you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: For the past few months I’ve been sending Dwight letters from the CIA. [hands a folder to Jim]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: They’re considering him for a top secret mission. There’s his application. Oh, and this is where I made him list every secret he promised he’d never ever tell.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So… here’s the gift. You get to decide what his top secret mission is. [Jim smiles] Sorry I didn’t wrap it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I get it, of course. OK. [holds out hand for folder. Jim gives Pam back the folder.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, what’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK, well, why are you laying like that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Like what?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well.. um I, I don’t…

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don’t need to know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I feel like I’ve been kinda cold to Karen and there’s no real reason for it. I mean it’s not like she’s ever done anything to me. So, I think I probably shouldn’t be cold to her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Karen. Sorry about that meeting today, that was really crazy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, usually like that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think one of her cats did once. She came in with scratches all over her face. [both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, I really liked your karaoke idea.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That could really be fun.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You guys do a raffle?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There is now. We just started it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What’s ours again?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Right, and if you’re interested in the way more fun party, all the info can be found here on our more brightly colored flyer. [Angela rips down brightly colored flyer and walks away. Karen rips down Angela’s flyer.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You can’t do that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That’s a great idea.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You can have your snack in here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: If you’re using more than three pieces of tape to wrap a present, you’re doing it wrong.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I just get those at any party supply place.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh yeah, your mom would love that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah… Maybe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hello everyone. We would just like to announce that our party is starting now in the break room. So… you can come by… .

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Our party is also starting now [opens door to break room.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good choice. [Kelly drags Ryan to the break room.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We have vodka!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I got goose bumps.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can I talk to you a second?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [holds up rice krispie shaped like a star] In the name of Nutcracker Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, but we don’t have a power cord.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm. Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We’ll go tell everyone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Night.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We should get him a bus ticket. [types on computer] To make his trip easier.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It costs seventy five dollars.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ohh… [laughs]

pam.summary: Pam is the secretary at Dunder Mifflin and tries to keep Michael somewhat focused on work and being productive. Pam is unaware of Jim's romantic interest in her during the early seasons of the show.
pam.name: Pam Beasley

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [singing] Shall I play for you? Pa rum pump um pum [Imitates heavy drumming] I have no gifts for you. Pa rum pump um pum [Imitates heavy drumming]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whassup!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whassup.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just clearing my desk. I can’t concentrate.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s overlapping. It’s all spilling over the edge. One word, two syllables. Demarcation.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You can’t do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Safety violation. I could fall and pierce an organ.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Downsizing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Downsizing? I have no problem with that. I have been recommending downsizing since I first got here. I even brought it up in my interview. I say, bring it on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m Assistant Regional Manager. I should know first.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, um, can you just tell me please? Just tell me quietly. Can you whisper it in my ear?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please, OK? Do you want me to tell ’em?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK. You tell ’em. With my permission. Permission granted.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: On his mother’s grave.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam, information is power.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight Schrute, Assistant Regional Manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh… yeah I got a ’78 280Z. Bought it for $1,200. Fixed it up. It’s now worth three grand.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: New engine, new suspension, I got a respray. I’ve got some photos.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn it! Jim!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He put my stuff in Jell-O again.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s real professional thanks. That’s the third time and it wasn’t funny the first two times either Jim.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s OK here, but people sometimes take advantage because it’s so relaxed. I’m a volunteer Sheriff’s Deputy on the weekends. And you cannot screw around there. That’s sort of one of the rules.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is my stapler.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK you know what, you can be a witness. [points to Ryan] Can you reprimand him?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s always you. Are you going to discipline him or not?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, that’s great. I guess what I’m most concerned with is damage to company property. That’s all.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight Schrute. My father’s name, also Dwight Schrute. My grandfather’s name, Dweide Schrude, Amish. That’s my family. I don’t know where they came, the Amish, came from originally. Uh, Amland.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: People respond to the human touch and that’s what I give them. I can look at a client and I can say, “Hello, how are you? How’s business been going?” And we can go back and forth for sometime and uh, then I’ll say, How much, how many reams do you want?” And they’ll order it and then I’ll take care of all the sales. I’ll make sure that they get that paper. And they appreciate that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That’s fine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m sorry it makes me nervous.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I understand. It’s in a blind spot because I’m trained in several martial arts and one of them, uh, includes, uh, an awareness that the masters bring, uh, of anything on all sides of you. It could be behind you or whatever. This is directly in a blind spot, so I’m trained to respond negatively to something right above my head. [new take] This now I have an eye on. You see, it’s on my periphery and if I needed to block it, attack it, stop it somehow. [does a martial arts move with his hands] I could come right out. I mean, I know you’re doing your job, but…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m doing my job.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes I do. I should have done it weeks ago actually.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Retaliation. Tit for tit.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, it should be.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have two. White and Indian.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A few of the ground rules?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, can we steer away from gay people?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I’m sorry. It’s an orientation. It’s not a race. Plus a lot of other races are intolerant of gays, so…paradox.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I figured it would save time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excuse me, I’m sorry, but that’s not all it takes to be a hero.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A hero kills people, people that wish him harm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A hero is part-human and part-supernatural. A hero is born out of a childhood trauma, or out of a disaster that must be avenged.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We all have a hero in our heart.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Lots of cultures eat rice, doesn’t help me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Um… Shalom. I’d like to apply for a loan.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, do me. Something stereotypical so I can get it really quick.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Outback steakhouse. [Australian accent] I’m Australian, mate!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, man, am I a woman?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am a salesman, okay. And I don’t think we should be doing this during prime sales hours. If you can prove to me that diversity is going to help my sales, I’ll go elephant running with James Earl Jones. I really will, but not on spec.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Solitaire is a one-player game. It can’t have two players.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What’s your win rate?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You’re not allowed to play two-player. You need to start over.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin, Michael Scott, Diversity Tomorrow, take four. And action.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Diversity Tomorrow, take five. Action.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Take six.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Action.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And action… Lights, camera, action. Whenever you’re ready.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cut.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, man, am I a woman?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: God!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s not fair.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you. Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good. [clears throat] So, am I a hunter gather culture?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do I live near a harbor or an ocean?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I’m an inland. Am I a mountainous?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Am I nomadic?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, okay, okay, okay. I think I got this. Um, I am treated in a foreign way with a great deal of prejudice. Am I one of those tribes in Africa? The piggies, or whatever?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. But I am, I am human, right? [Pam hesitates]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Dwight’s new race is ‘Dwight’] I could be French.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [takes his ‘Dwight’ race off his forehead] Damn it, Jim! That’s not funny, Jim!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. I can do it. I’m your man.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, first, let’s go over some parameters. How many people can I fire?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, we’ll table that for the time being. Two, I’ll need an office. I think the conference room should be fine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to self] Yes, I have an office. [to camera] Bigger than his.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, I take it back, it’s a workspace.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What did I do? I did my job. I slashed benefits to the bone. I saved this company money. Was I too harsh? Maybe. I don’t believe in coddling people.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In the wild, there is no health care. In the wild, health care is, “Ow, I hurt my leg. I can’t run. A lion eats me and I’m dead.” Well, I’m not dead. I’m the lion. You’re dead.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, knock, please. Please knock. This is an office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Same thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just knock, Please? As a sign of respect for your superior.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh gee, then why do I have an office?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. And my decision in final.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aww, times are tough, Pam. Deal with it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don’t need it. Never been sick. Perfect immune system.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don’t need them. Superior genes. I’m a Schrute. And superior brain power. Through concentration, I can raise and lower my cholesterol at will.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So I can lower it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It’s a great plan. It saves the company a fortune.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, you said…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can handle that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, everyone. Gather round. Step forward. It has been brought to my attention that some of you are unhappy with my plan. So what I’d like you to do is to fill this out and write down any diseases you have that you might want covered and I’ll see what I can do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, well, I didn’t say to write your name down, did I? Fill it out, leave it anonymous. Or, don’t write any disease down at all and it won’t be covered. Sound fair? Good. I’ll be in my office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damnit! Damnit Jim!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All right, who did this? I’m not mad. I just want to know who did it so I can punish them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, someone forged, uh, medical information and that is a felony.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, leprosy? Flesh eating bacteria. Hot-dog fingers. Government-created killer nanorobot infection.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You did this, didn’t you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes you did.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know it was you. Fine. You know what? I’ll have to interview each and every one of you until the perpetrator makes him or herself known. And until that time, there will be no health care coverage for any one!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The problem, Jim, is that people who are really suffering from a medical condition won’t receive the care they need, because someone in this office is coming up with all this ridiculous stuff. [reads off of paper] “Count Choculitis”

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why did you write that down Jim? Is it because you know I love Count Chocula?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think you need to confess…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: …the fact…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are you doing? Those are my keys.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim! Damnit! No! Jim! Let me out! Jim! Let… [Without looking, Jim throws his keys to his left, they land on a shelf next to Stanley]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me out or you’re fired.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes I can. I’m manager for the day. Clean out your desk.

quotes.text: Jim!
